General Increased susceptibility to infectious diseases Rheumatic diseases Symptoms of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) Other clinical features: Recurrent bacterial infections

consequence.term: point mutation in the exon 2 leading to a premature stop codon in the C1Q domain

comment.text: Information is based on database description. Actual diagnose is missing

Bacterial infections Pneumonia Otitis Kidney abnormalities Severe renal malfunction Other clinical features: At the age of 5.5 years patient presented with erythematous and crusted, desquamative skin lesions on his face and extremities. Patient had also oral aphtous lesions. Patient developed glomerulonephritis three years later and after 9 months he died of renal failure.

consequence.term: point mutation in the exon 2 leading to a premature stop codon in the C1Q domain
